title: Mount Chiquita
text:
Mount Chiquita is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> <a href="summit">summit</a> in the <a href="Mummy%20Range">Mummy Range</a> of the <a href="Rocky%20Mountains">Rocky Mountains</a> of <a href="North%20America">North America</a>. The <a href="thirteener">thirteener</a> is located in <a href="Rocky%20Mountain%20National%20Park">Rocky Mountain National Park</a>, northwest by west (<a href="Absolute%20bearing">bearing</a> 298°) of the <a href="Estes%20Park%2C%20Colorado">Town of Estes Park</a> in <a href="Larimer%20County%2C%20Colorado">Larimer County</a>, <a href="Colorado">Colorado</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
Tourists can reach Mount Chiquita via Chapin Pass which is an 8.0 kilometer out and back trail located near Estes Park, Colorado that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail is primarily used for hiking and running and is accessible year-round.
